name: src/channel.js
Channel
description: Rxmq channel class

name: constructor
description:
Represents a new Rxmq channel.
Normally you wouldn't need to instantiate it directly, you'd just work with existing instance.

params.name: plugins
params.description: Array of plugins for new channel

name: utils
description: Internal set of utilities

name: subjects
description: Instances of subjects

name: channelBus
description: Channel bus

name: channelStream
description: Permanent channel bus stream as Observable

name: subject
description: Returns EndlessSubject representing given topic
examples:
const channel = rxmq.channel('test');
const subject = channel.subject('test.topic');

name: observe
description: Get an Observable for specific set of topics

return.description: Observable for given set of topics

name: request
description:
Do a request that will be replied into returned AsyncSubject
Alias for '.request()' that uses single object as params

return.description: AsyncSubject that will dispatch the response

name: registerPlugin
description: Channel plugin registration

name: [prop]
description: Hide from esdoc

name: src/index.js
src/rx/endlessReplaySubject.js
EndlessReplaySubject
description:
EndlessReplaySubject extension of ReplaySubject.
This is pretty hacky, but so far I'd found no better way of having
Subjects that do no close on multicasted stream completion and on multiple errors.
For documentation refer to
[ReplaySubject doc](@link https://github.com/Reactive-Extensions/RxJS/blob/master/doc/api/subjects/replaysubject.md).
The only difference is that EndlessReplaySubject never triggers '.complete()' and
does not closes observers on errors (thus allowing to continuously dispatch them).

name: complete
description: Dummy method override to prevent execution and Observable completion

name: error
description: Override of error method that prevents stopping that Observer

name: src/rx/endlessSubject.js
EndlessSubject
description:
EndlessSubject extension of Rx.Subject.
This is pretty hacky, but so far I'd found no better way of having
Subjects that do no close on multicasted stream completion and on multiple errors.
For documentation refer to
[Rx.Subject docs](@link https://github.com/Reactive-Extensions/RxJS/blob/master/doc/api/subjects/subject.md).
The only difference is that EndlessSubject never triggers '.complete()' and
does not closes observers on errors (thus allowing to continuously dispatch them).

name: complete
description: Dummy method override to prevent execution and Rx.Observable completion

name: error
description: Override of error method that prevents stopping that Rx.Observer

name: src/rx/index.js
content:
export { EndlessSubject } from './endlessSubject';
export { EndlessReplaySubject } from './endlessReplaySubject';

name: src/rxmq.js
Rxmq
description: Rxmq message bus class

name: constructor
description:
Represents a new Rxmq message bus.
Normally you'd just use a signleton returned by default, but it's also
possible to create a new instance of Rxmq should you need it.
examples:
import {Rxmq} from 'rxmq';
const myRxmq = new Rxmq();

name: channels
description: Holds channels definitions

name: channelPlugins
description: Holds channel plugins definitions

name: channel
description: Returns a channel for given name

name: registerPlugin
description: Register new Rxmq plugin

name: [prop]
description: Hide from esdoc

name: registerChannelPlugin
description: Register new Channel plugin

name: src/utils/compareTopics.js
topicToRegex
description: Converts topic to search regex

name: compareTopics
description: Compares given topic with existing topic

return.description: Whether topic is included in existingTopic

name: src/utils/findTopicByName.js
findSubjectByName
description: Find a specific subject by given name

params.name: subjects
params.description: Array of subjects to search in

name: src/utils/index.js
content:

export { findSubjectByName } from './findTopicByName';
